profile.name: Austin Klein
profile.biography: My name is Austin Klein. I am a Software Engineer who has been working as a full stack developer for the last 5 years. I have contributed to business critical applications and high value division wide initiatives. I have organized multiple modernization efforts on my dev team, and taught teammates new skills when they were new to a technology. In my free time I also enjoy building with my hands, along with many outdoor activities such as rowing, skiing, and biking.

careers.title: Vanguard
careers.description: During this time I held three development roles. I started as a Dev I out of college and was then promoted twice and given the Distinguished merit rating twice, both within 5 years. For the majority of this time I was a full stack developer and would work on the UI, Service, Batch jobs, along with database queries.

careers.title: EagleDream Technologies
careers.description: During my second co-op I worked on a number of software projects, at times from conception to completion. I was in charge of testing my own deliverables in order to assure they fit the requirements. I was also able to work with a number of different technologies many of which were new to me.

careers.title: Soleo Communications
careers.description: My first co-op while attending RIT allowed me to own the entire quality assurance process and quality of the product. I developed Selenium test scripts and automated testing plans as well as participated in design reviews and planning meetings. This gave me a chance to learn what the 'real world' of Software Engineering was like and cement my interest in the field.

careers.title: Crellin Park
careers.description: I worked as a camp counselor in Upstate NY for the Town of Chatham, Recreation Department. As a counselor, I would arrange a safe and fun environment for kids to play and learn through games and programs. In 2012, I became a head counselor. In addition to managing a group of children, I also oversaw junior counselor's activities to ensure proper work ethic. It was the goal of our Recreation Department to provide diverse activities for the children to produce a well-rounded experience.

careers.title: Jiminy Peak Mountain Resort
careers.description: I got my first job as soon as I turned 14 and was legally allowed to work. At Jiminy Peak, I learned how to communicate effectively with individuals, whether the individual was my supervisor, a parent, or a three year-old. As an instructor, I taught five hour ski lessons to children aged three through twelve. Their skill levels varied from beginner to expert.

educations.title: Rochester Institute of Technology
educations.description: This university offered a fantastic co-op program which helped me get over a year of full time experience at a few different companies before I even graduated. While attending RIT I was part of the Varsity Crew for a few years, took classes in a range of subjects, and was able to figure out what I wanted to get out of a full-time job.

educations.title: Chatham Highschool
educations.description: During highschool I was an active member of the Varisty Tennis and Varisty Cross Country teams. I also enjoyed music and played multiple instruments in both the concert and marching bands. I took two computer science classes which gave me my first taste of the field.

technical_skills.title: ECS, S3, RDS, DMS, Athena, Lambda

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.description: This personal website was created to document my growth in the professional world. It was created using AngularJS, Bootstrap, CSS, and HTML. A JSON file stores most of the personal details which allows for easy updating and easy reuse of the code for other users.

projects.title: Smart Mirror
projects.description: I made a raspberry pi hosted local website that is displayed on a monitor behind one-way glass. It auto updates weather, traffic, news, and a daily comic from different free API's.

projects.title: Chat Project
projects.description: I updated most of the pages facing the public while on my second co-op at EagleDream. The main functionality was completed by another employee. This site is also using AngularJS and Bootstrap.

projects.title: Skoolie Build
projects.description: This is my 40 foot School Bus that I am renovating into a Motorhome. I am learning each skill as I get there and am currently starting to insulate and frame the interior.
